title: Synthetic Health-related Longitudinal Data with Mixed-type Variables Generated using Diffusion Models. (arXiv:2303.12281v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: This paper presents a novel approach to simulating electronic health records (EHRs) using diffusion probabilistic models (DPMs). Specifically, we demonstrate the effectiveness of DPMs in synthesising longitudinal EHRs that capture mixed-type variables, including numeric, binary, and categorical variables. To our knowledge, this represents the first use of DPMs for this purpose. We compared our DPM-simulated datasets to previous state-of-the-art results based on generative adversarial networks (GANs) for two clinical applications: acute hypotension and human immunodeficiency virus (ART for HIV). Given the lack of similar previous studies in DPMs, a core component of our work involves exploring the advantages and caveats of employing DPMs across a wide range of aspects. translated_title: 用扩散模型生成混合型变量的合成健康相关纵向数据
translated_abstract: 本文提出了一种使用扩散概率模型（DPMs）模拟电子健康记录（EHRs）的新方法。我们展示了DPMs在合成捕获数值，二进制和分类变量的纵向EHRs方面的有效性。据我们所知，这是第一次使用DPMs实现这个目的。我们将DPM合成的数据集与以往使用生成对抗网络（GANs）的最新研究结果进行了比较，应用于两种临床应用：急性低血压和人类免疫缺陷病毒（HIV ART）。鉴于以前在DPMs方面缺乏类似的研究，我们的工作核心组成部分是探索在许多方面使用DPMs的优点和注意事项。除了评估合成数据集的逼真性之外，我们还在合成数据上训练了强化学习（RL）代理以评估它们支持下游机器学习开发的实用性。
tldr: 该论文提出了一种使用扩散模型合成纵向健康记录数据的新方法，该方法能够捕捉数值、二进制和分类变量。使用合成数据集评估强化学习代理支持下游机器学习开发的实用性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel approach using diffusion probabilistic models (DPMs) for synthesizing longitudinal electronic health records (EHRs) that capture mixed-type variables. Reinforcement learning (RL) agents are trained on the synthetic data to evaluate their usefulness for supporting downstream machine learning development.
